types.apps: Items of this type are applications that are intentionally created to be Vim-alike in some respect.
types.plugs: Items of this type are plugins for applications that make them behave Vim-like to various extent.
types.confs: Items of this type have bindings that are either already similar or configurable to resemble Vim-like behaviour to a degree.

items.name: Cream-Browser
items.descr: A Vim-like lightweight Web browser with Vimperator interface.
comments: looks abandoned

items.name: dwb
items.descr: Quite nicely done Vim-like browser, modulo some issues with memory.
comments: author claimed to abandon it, but there is some activity

items.name: jumanji
items.descr: The idea behind jumanji is a Web browser that provides a minimalistic and space saving interface as well as an easy usage that mainly focuses on keyboard interaction like Vimperator does.
comments: stale development

items.name: luakit
items.descr: Fast, small, WebKit based browser framework extensible by Lua.

items.name: qutebrowser
items.descr: Qutebrowser is a keyboard-focused browser with a minimal GUI.
comments: see bizarre claims about software development in FAQ there: https://www.qutebrowser.org/FAQ.html

items.name: surf
items.descr: Ultra-minimalistic Web browser.
comments: supports XEmbed protocol (instead of tabs)
process per tab

items.name: Uzbl
items.descr: Web interface tools which adhere to the unix philosophy.
comments: requires configuration (syntax wasn't really obvious)
process per tab

items.name: Vimprobable
items.descr: A lean stand-alone web browser optimised for full keyboard control (inspired by Vimperator).
comments: didn't have history and cookies (claimed that this is for security)

items.name: vimb
items.descr: Vim-like browser based on the WebKit engine and the GTK toolkit.

items.name: xombrero
items.descr: A minimalist's Web browser, which strives to be Vi-like for heavy keyboard users while maintaining traditional Web browser behavior.
comments: formerly known as xxxterm
stale development

items.name: lynx
items.descr: Text Web browser.
comments: has Vi-like mode (`-vikeys` command-line option)

items.name: Netrik
items.descr: A simplistic text mode (character cell display) Web browser, similar to w3m or Lynx.
comments: stale development

items.name: w3m
items.descr: w3m is a text-based Web browser as well as a pager like `more' or `less'.

items.name: mutt
items.descr: Mutt is a small but very powerful text-based mail client for Unix operating systems.

items.name: notmuch
items.descr: E-mail indexer/framework, which provides plugin for Vim.

items.name: sup
items.descr: A console-based e-mail client for people with a lot of e-mail.

items.name: wyrd
items.descr: A text-based front-end to remind, a sophisticated calendar and alarm program.

items.name: bvi
items.descr: A display-oriented editor for binary files (hex editor).

items.name: bvi plus
items.descr: Fork of bvi with more features.

items.name: elvis
items.descr: A free Vi clone for Unix and other operating systems.

items.name: ex-vi
items.descr: The traditional vi editor, ported to modern Unix systems.

items.name: Kakoune
items.descr: Interactive only editor inspired by Vim.
comments: not really Vim-like judging by examples in the Readme

items.name: neovim
items.descr: Fork of Vim.
comments: has several incompatibilities with Vim (like dropped command-line options, no interactivity on `:!`, see https://neovim.io/doc/user/vim_diff.html)
GUI is implemented in separate projects: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/Related-projects#gui

items.name: nvi
items.descr: Vi reimplementation.

items.name: nvi
items.descr: Very opinionated Node.JS VI clone.
comments: looks abandoned

items.name: pyvim
items.descr: Pure Python Vim clone.
comments: not sure how Vim-like it is

items.name: spacemacs
items.descr: An Emacs-based editor that draws heavily from Vim keybindings.

items.name: vile
items.descr: Vi clone with multiple buffers and similar features from Emacs added.

items.name: Vim
items.descr: The ubiquitous text editor.

items.name: vis
items.descr: A Vim-like text editor.
comments: if I get it right, it's not really that Vim-like (e.g. lots of Lua is used) and is deliberately handicapped compared to Vim

items.name: WinVi
items.descr: Vi-like text and hex editor, which also tries to be Notepad compatible.
comments: stale development

items.name: xvi
items.descr: The smallest full-function Vi text editor clone.

items.name: Yzis
items.descr: A Vi/Vim engine that can be integrated in graphical applications.
comments: stale development

items.name: jvifm
items.descr: A try of implementing graphical Vi-like file manager in Java.
comments: two-pane kind of interface
abandoned

items.name: lf
items.descr: Terminal file manager, which is a clone of ranger.

items.name: noice
items.descr: Small file browser.
comments: very minimalistic

items.name: ranger
items.descr: A console file manager with Vi key bindings, includes application association guessing tool.
comments: miller columns kind of interface

items.name: rover
items.descr: A small file browser that aims to be simple, fast and portable.

items.name: Vide
items.descr: A graphical predecessor of vifm.
comments: see `buildable-version` branch and supply `CFLAGS=-std=gnu90` on modern GCC (C99 semantics of inline conflicts with GTK+1) if you want to try it out
abandoned many years ago

items.name: vifm
items.descr: File manager with Vi like keybindings/modes/options/commands/configuration, which also borrows some useful ideas from mutt.
comments: single/two-pane kind of interface

items.name: cmus
items.descr: Not so minimalistic terminal player.

items.name: herrie
items.descr: Minimalistic player with curses interface.
comments: uses mplayer to play the music
main controls aren't very Vi-like

items.name: pms
items.descr: Probably the most Vi-like music player (MPD client).
comments: is in constant rewrite process sometimes with very long pauses
the database is presented as one long list

items.name: Siren
items.descr: A text-based audio player for Unix-like operating systems, inspired by cmus.

items.name: vimpc
items.descr: Client for mpd with Vi-like key bindings.
comments: using it wasn't very intuitive

items.name: vimus
items.descr: Terminal MPD client with Vim-like key bindings.

items.name: vitunes
items.descr: Console playlist/music database manager with Vi-like bindings.
comments: uses mplayer to play the music

items.name: apvlv
items.descr: A PDF/DJVU/UMD/TXT viewer under Linux/WIN32, which tries to behave like Vim.
comments: remember it being kinda raw, but usable

items.name: zathura
items.descr: A document viewer with plugin system.
comments: had troubles installing newer version, so using the old one
search used to be one match at a time, later was changed to whole-document search, which is very slow on huge documents

items.name: jV
items.descr: Plugin for Firefox, Pale Moon, Basilisk.

items.name: Vimperator
items.descr: Plugin for Firefox, Pale Moon, Basilisk.

items.name: Pentadactyl
items.descr: Plugin for Firefox, Pale Moon, Basilisk.

items.name: Vimium
items.descr: Plugin for Firefox, Pale Moon, Basilisk.

items.name: VimFx
items.descr: Plugin for Firefox, Pale Moon, Basilisk.

items.name: Vim Vixen
items.descr: Plugin for Firefox, Pale Moon, Basilisk.

items.name: Tridactyl
items.descr: Plugin for Firefox.

items.name: Surfingkeys
items.descr: Plugin for Chrome and Chromium.
comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near Vimperator/Pentodactyl

items.name: cVim
items.descr: Plugin for Chrome and Chromium.

items.name: ViChrome
items.descr: Plugin for Chrome and Chromium.
comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near Vimperator/Pentodactyl

items.name: Vrome
items.descr: Plugin for Chrome and Chromium.
comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near Vimperator/Pentodactyl

items.name: vimlike-smooziee
items.descr: Plugin for Chrome and Chromium.
comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near Vimperator/Pentodactyl

items.name: Vimium
items.descr: Plugin for Chrome and Chromium.
comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near Vimperator/Pentodactyl

items.name: VimOperate
items.descr: Plugin for Opera.
comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near Vimperator/Pentodactyl

items.name: Eclim
items.descr: Two-way integration between Eclipse IDE and Vim.

items.name: ExEdit
items.descr: Pluging for running Ex command in Eclipse IDE.

items.name: Viable
items.descr: Plugin for Eclipse IDE.

items.name: viPlugin
items.descr: Plugin for Eclipse IDE.

items.name: vimplugin
items.descr: An attempt to use the Vim editor inside the Eclipse IDE.
comments: might be outdated

items.name: vrapper
items.descr: Plugin for Eclipse IDE that supposedly preserves original keybindings.

items.name: Vimpulse
items.descr: Emulates Vim's most useful features.
comments: Superseded-By: evil-mode

items.name: eVil
items.descr: The extensible vi layer for Emacs.

items.name: Viper
items.descr: Emacs mode that emulates vi key bindings.

items.name: Vim Mode
items.descr: An implementation of Vi and Vim-like key bindings for Emacs.
comments: Evil supersedes this project.

items.name: CubicleVim
items.descr: A COM Add-In to allow editing Microsoft Outlook messages.

items.name: FakeVim
items.descr: Standard QtCreator plugin (the link is to the widget).
comments: was quite good implementation compared to many others

items.name: IDEAVim
items.descr: IntelliJ IDEA Vim-like plugin.

items.name: jVi
items.descr: NetBeans IDE Vim-like plugin.
comments: one of the closest Vim-like emulation plugins, among those I've ever tried

items.name: Melodactyl
items.descr: Vim-like plugin for Sunbird.

items.name: Muttator
items.descr: Vim-like plugin for Thunderbird.

items.name: Teledactyl
items.descr: Vim-like plugin for Thunderbird.

items.name: Sublime Six
items.descr: Successor of Vintageous plugin for Sublime Text.

items.name: vibreoffice
items.descr: LibreOffice plugin that adds Vim-like shortcuts and modality.

items.name: viemu
items.descr: Plugins for Visual Studio, Xcode, Outlook, Word, SQL Server.
comments: tried it for Visual Studio, it wasn't bad, but it left me unimpressed (quite long time ago)

items.name: viex
items.descr: NetBeans IDE Vim-like plugin.

items.name: Vintage
items.descr: Vim-like plugin for Sublime Text.

items.name: VintageEx
items.descr: A rendition of Vim's command-line mode for Sublime Text 2.
comments: previous incarnation of Vingageous

items.name: Vintageous
items.descr: Vintageous is a comprehensive vi/Vim emulation layer for Sublime Text 3.
comments: README says that Vintageous has been discontinued and its successor is Sublime Six (not open source)

items.name: Vim Mode
items.descr: Plugin for Atom.

items.name: ViTunes
items.descr: A Vim plugin that allows you to control iTunes.

items.name: VsVim
items.descr: Vim emulation layer for Visual Studio.

items.name: XVim
items.descr: Xcode plugin for Vim keybindings.

items.name: athame
items.descr: Full vim for your shell (bash, zsh, gdb, python, etc).
comments: integrates into applications that provide command-line input and runs Vim in background to do the work.

items.name: Blender
items.descr: Blender is the free and open source 3D creation suite.
comments: https://learntemail.sam.today/blog/blender-for-hackers-3d-modeling-is-just-like-using-vim/

items.name: cgdb
items.descr: Console front-end to the GNU debugger.

items.name: less
items.descr: Its controls are Vi-like.

items.name: Kommand
items.descr: AutoHotKey script, which provides cross-application Vim-like hot key solution.

items.name: ncdu
items.descr: Disk usage browser.

items.name: newsbeuter
items.descr: The Mutt of RSS feed readers.

items.name: PIDA
items.descr: An IDE that allows integration of Vim/Emacs as editor.
comments: looks abandoned

items.name: pipedial
items.descr: One more tool for selecting something in console.
comments: inspired by sentaku

items.name: sc
items.descr: Terminal spreadsheet editor.

items.name: sc-im
items.descr: Improved version of sc.

items.name: sentaku
items.descr: Utility to make selection window with shell command.

items.name: Termite
items.descr: A keyboard-centric terminal.

items.name: tig
items.descr: Text-mode interface for git.

items.name: TuDu
items.descr: Vi-like TODO manager.

items.name: vchatter
items.descr: Vi-like jabber client.
comments: stale development

items.name: ViPaint
items.descr: A modal, Vi like painting program.

items.name: vlrtt
items.descr: Vim-like real-time tactics game.

items.name: VNote
items.descr: A Vim-inspired note-taking application, which can also be used as Markdown editor.

items.name: GNU Screen
items.descr: This terminal multiplexer can be configured to use some Vi-like keys, it also has command-line mode.
comments: Screen has command classes, which allows implementing modes: https://github.com/xaizek/dotfiles/blob/496c12983935288b4308fa1bb078db3c7a75c663/screenrc#L175-L192

items.name: tmux
items.descr: This terminal multiplexer can be configured to use some Vi-like keys, it also has command-line mode.
comments: Screen has command classes, which allows implementing modes: https://github.com/xaizek/dotfiles/blob/496c12983935288b4308fa1bb078db3c7a75c663/screenrc#L175-L192

items.name: Editra
items.descr: Editra is a multi-platform text editor with an implementation that focuses on creating an easy to use interface and features that aid in code development.
comments: has Vi-like editing mode: http://editra.org/vi_emulation

items.name: SlickEdit
items.descr: A true cross-platform, multi-language code editor, with support for over 60 languages on 9 platforms.
comments: has Vi-like editing mode
previously known as Visual SlickEdit

items.name: Kate
items.descr: The KDE Advanced Text Editor (Kate).
comments: has Vi-like editing mode

items.name: AbiWord
items.descr: AbiWord is a free word processing program similar to MicrosoftÂ® Word. It is suitable for a wide variety of word processing tasks.
comments: has Vi-like bindings: http://recycledelectron.blogspot.com/2009/01/vi-and-emacs-key-bindings-in-abiword.html

items.name: bash
items.descr: An sh-compatible shell that incorporates useful features from the Korn shell (ksh) and C shell (csh).
comments: has Vi-like bindings: set -o vi
you can see current mode by adding `set show-mode-in-prompt On` to `~/.inputrc`

items.name: zsh
items.descr: An sh-compatible shell that incorporates useful features from the Korn shell (ksh) and C shell (csh).
comments: has Vi-like bindings: bindkey -v

items.name: GNU ReadLine
items.descr: The library provides a set of functions for use by applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed in.
comments: add `set editing-mode vi` to `~/.inputrc` to enables Vi-like mode in all applications that use readline

items.name: MonoDevelop
items.descr: Cross platform IDE for C#, F# and more.
comments: has Vi mode

items.name: GNOME Builder
items.descr: A toolsmith for GNOME-based applications.
comments: has Vi mode: https://wiki.gnome.org/Apps/Builder/Planning/VIM

items.name: Komodo Edit
items.descr: Komodo Edit is a free text editor for dynamic programming languages.
comments: has Vi mode: https://www.activestate.com/blog/komodos-vi-emulation/

items.name: feh
items.descr: An X11 image viewer aimed mostly at console users.
comments: bindings can be configured to be like in Vi

items.name: pim
items.descr: Python image viewer with Vim-like keybindings.

items.name: sxiv
items.descr: Simple X Image Viewer.
comments: some bindings are like in Vi

items.name: vimiv
items.descr: An image viewer with Vim-like keybindings.

items.name: xzgv
items.descr: Image viewer with at least j/k mapped.

items.name: Evince
items.descr: A document viewer for multiple document formats.
languages: C and a bit of C++
comments: has h/j/k/l mappings

items.name: MuPDF
items.descr: A lightweight PDF and XPS viewer.
comments: bindings are relatively Vi-like

items.name: Okular
items.descr: A universal document viewer developed by KDE.
comments: supports h/j/k/l

items.name: euclid
items.descr: Window manager with kind of Vim-like default mappings.

items.name: howm
items.descr: A lightweight, X11 tiling window manager that is promises to behave like Vim (objects/motions/count).
comments: tries to follow Unix-way too much (see next comment)
I used the word "promises" in the description because howm demonstrated severe issues with input processing when I gave it a try, drawing it useless

items.name: i3
items.descr: Tiling WM.
comments: it seems to be possible to define Vim-like modes and there are some predefined ones

items.name: wmii
items.descr: A small, scriptable window manager, with a 9P filesystem interface and an acme-like layout.
comments: has basic Vi bindings by default

items.name: calcurse
items.descr: Terminal calendar and scheduling application with some Vim-like keys by default.

items.name: CopyQ
items.descr: Clipboard manager with advanced features, which claims "support for simple Vim-like editor and shortcuts".

items.name: ncmpc
items.descr: MPD client, which is somewhat Vim-like.

items.name: ncmpcpp
items.descr: MPD client, which is somewhat Vim-like.

items.name: NetHack
items.descr: Rougue-like game with h/j/k/l.

items.name: rekonq
items.descr: A Web browser for KDE based on WebKit.  Has basic Vi-like keys.
comments: looks abandoned

items.name: rexima
items.descr: Vi-like audio-mixer alternative to alsamixer.

items.name: rtv
items.descr: Reddit terminal viewer provides a text-based interface to view and interact with reddit.

items.name: urxvt
items.descr: Fork of rxvt terminal emulator that adds Unicode support.
comments: looks like it's possible to make it somewhat Vim-like: https://github.com/ervandew/urxvt-vim-scrollback

items.name: WeeChat
items.descr: The extensible IRC client.
comments: bindings can be configured to be like in Vi
see https://github.com/GermainZ/weechat-vimode

items.name: xpdf
items.descr: Xpdf is a free PDF viewer and toolkit, including a text extractor, image converter, HTML converter, and more. Most of the tools are available as open source.
comments: Can be configured to be somewhat Vi-like: http://stackoverflow.com/a/11241095

items.name: rtorrent
items.descr: A text-based ncurses BitTorrent client.
comments: There is a patch for Vi-like keys: https://github.com/spcmd/rtorrent-ps/blob/master/vi_keybindings-spcmd.patch

items.name: htop
items.descr: An interactive system-monitor process-viewer and process-manager.
comments: There is a patch for Vi-like keys: https://bbs.archlinux.org/viewtopic.php?pid=726353#p726353

items.name: DuckDuckGo
items.descr: An Internet search engine that emphasizes protecting searchers' privacy and avoiding the filter bubble of personalized search results.
comments: Somewhat Vi-like keys are available, but shortcuts do conflict with Vim-like browsers/plugins, which makes them significantly less useful.

items.name: GitHub
items.descr: An interactive system-monitor process-viewer and process-manager.
comments: Somewhat Vi-like keys are available, but shortcuts do conflict with Vim-like browsers/plugins, which makes them significantly less useful.

items.name: GMail
items.descr: Google mail.
comments: Somewhat Vi-like keys are available, but shortcuts do conflict with Vim-like browsers/plugins, which makes them significantly less useful.

items.name: Habr
items.descr: Russian collaborative blog with elements of social network.
comments: Somewhat Vi-like keys are available, but shortcuts do conflict with Vim-like browsers/plugins, which makes them significantly less useful.
